page.title: 17SHERBORNE ABBEY
page.content: The Abbey is the main attraction of Sherborne for visitors. The Abbey was sited on the West side of the town in 705. It is the centre of religious life in Sherborne. Between 1849_80 the Abbey was completely restored. The domestic buildings on the North side of the Abbey are now part of the Sherborne School apart from two exceptions. The walls of the Abbey are of local rubble with dressing and much ashlar facing of Ham Hill stone. The roof was replac _ed during 1977_80. One of the treasures of the Abbey is a fine missal, in which beautifully inscribed lettering was done by John Whas, a monk of Sherborne. In 1539 the Abbey was bought for Â£300 to become the parish church. The first Bishop of Sherborne was St Aldhelm.
